tests.input: 톰은 거짓말 탐지기 테스트를 받는 것에 동의했다.
tests.output: Tom has agreed to take a lie detector test.
tests.llm_output: Tom agreed to take a lie detector test.

tests.input: 대부분의 사람들은 그런 일에 신경쓰지 않는다.
tests.output: Most people don't care about things like that.
tests.llm_output: Most people don't care about that.

tests.input: 우리 누나는 아버지에게 새 자전거를 사 달라고 부탁했다.
tests.output: My sister asked my father to buy her a new bicycle.
tests.llm_output: My sister asked my father to buy me a new bike.

tests.input: 내 여동생은 아버지에게 새 자전거를 사 달라고 부탁했다.
tests.output: My sister asked my father to buy her a new bicycle.
tests.llm_output: My sister asked my father to buy me a new bike.

tests.input: 나는 고양이 한 마리와 개 한 마리가 있다. 고양이는 검고 개는 하얗다.
tests.output: I have a cat and a dog. The cat is black, and the dog is white.
tests.llm_output: I have a cat and a dog. A cat is black and a dog is white.

tests.input: 내 시각으로 이런 식의 대처는 현명하지 않을 수도 있다.
tests.output: From my perspective, this sort of approach may not be wise.
tests.llm_output: From my perspective, this approach may not be wise.

tests.input: 내가 이렇게 건강한 것은 우리 부모님 덕이다.
tests.output: I owe it to my parents that I'm so healthy.
tests.llm_output: It's because of my parents that I'm so healthy.

tests.input: 실례합니다. 대전에 가는 다음 기차가 몇 시에 있습니까?
tests.output: Excuse me. What time is the next train to Taejon?
tests.llm_output: Excuse me, what time is the next train going to the Great War?

tests.input: 네가 맞을 지도 모르는데, 난 다른 의견을 갖고 있어.
tests.output: You may be right, but I have a different view.
tests.llm_output: Maybe you're right, but I have a different opinion.

tests.input: 우리 실험은 그의 보고가 정확하지 않았음을 밝혀내었다.
tests.output: Our experiment has revealed that his report was inaccurate.
tests.llm_output: Our experiment revealed that his report was not accurate.

tests.input: 마지막 피자 한 조각을 제가 먹어도 괜찮을까요?
tests.output: Would it be OK if I ate the last slice of pizza?
tests.llm_output: Would it be okay if I ate the last piece of pizza?

tests.input: 그건 내 생각이 아니라 톰의 생각이었어. 내 탓 하지 마.
tests.output: It was Tom's idea, not mine. Don't blame me.
tests.llm_output: It wasn't my idea. It was Tom's idea. Don't blame me.

tests.input: 영수증을 잃어버려서 이케아와 은행, 둘 다의 고객서비스에 전화해야 했어.
tests.output: I lost my receipt and had to call customer service at both IKEA and the bank.
tests.llm_output: I had to call both Ikea and the bank and the customer service because I lost my receipt.

tests.input: 사무총장은 전쟁 중인 두 파벌 간에 평화조약을 협상하기 위해서 필사적으로 노력하고 있다.
tests.output: The Secretary General is making a last-ditch effort to negotiate a peace treaty between the two warring factions.
tests.llm_output: The secretary-in-law is desperately trying to negotiate a peace treaty between the two parties at war.

tests.input: 폴란드 소녀들은 저스틴 비버가 폴란드를 방문하는 것을 원치 않았다.
tests.output: Polish girls didn't want Justin Bieber to come to Poland.
tests.llm_output: Polish girls did not want Justin Bieber to visit Poland.

tests.input: 톰은 마침내 용기를 내어 메리에게 데이트 신청을 했다.
tests.output: Tom finally gathered up his courage and asked Mary out on a date.
tests.llm_output: Tom finally mustered up the courage to ask Mary out on a date.

tests.input: 우리 부모님께서는 나를 배웅하러 공항에 오셨다.
tests.output: My parents came to see me off at the airport.
tests.llm_output: My parents came to the airport to escort me.

tests.input: 문제는 우리가 가진 돈이 많지 않다는 것이다.
tests.output: The problem is that we don't have a lot of money.
tests.llm_output: The problem is we don't have much money.

tests.input: 단언컨대, 우린 그런 실수를 두 번 다시 하지 않을 거야.
tests.output: I can assure you we'll never make that mistake again.
tests.llm_output: I assure you, we're not going to make that mistake again.

tests.input: 톰은 원래 함부르크에서 브레멘으로 가려고 했는데, 실수로 베를린 직행 기차를 타게 되었던 것이다. 그는 잘못을 깨닫곤 눈물을 글썽였다.
tests.output: Tom originally wanted to go from Hamburg to Bremen, but he mistakenly boarded a direct train to Berlin. After realizing his mistake, he had tears in his eyes.
tests.llm_output: Tom was supposed to go from Hamburg to Bremen, but he accidentally got on a train directly to Berlin, and when he realized he was wrong, he was in tears.

tests.input: 우리는 2시 30분에 박물관 앞에서 만나기로 했다.
tests.output: We're going to meet in front of the museum at 2:30.
tests.llm_output: We were supposed to meet at the museum at 2:30.

tests.input: 톰, 네가 이제서야 오다니! 난 막 자살할까 그냥 자러갈까 고민하던 참이었었는데.
tests.output: Now you come, Tom! I was just debating whether to kill myself or just go to sleep.
tests.llm_output: Tom, I was just trying to figure out if I was gonna kill myself or go to bed.

tests.input: 왜 날 파티에 초대하지 않은 거야? "초대했어! 이메일 못 본 거야?"
tests.output: Why didn't you invite me to the party? "I did invite you! Haven't you looked at your email?"
tests.llm_output: Why didn't you invite me to a party?

tests.input: 마음에 드는 돌멩이를 집었으면, 얼른 집으로 가져가 잘 돌보도록 한다. 그게 그대의 유일한 돌멩이이기 때문이다.
tests.output: Once you've picked up a stone that you like, take it home as soon as you can and treat it well, because that's the only stone you've got.
tests.llm_output: If you've got a rock you like, take it home and take good care of it, because it's your only rock.

tests.input: 메리와 앨리스가 서로 자매라는 것을 알고 있었어?
tests.output: Did you know Mary and Alice were sisters?
tests.llm_output: Did you know that Mary and Alice are sisters?

tests.input: 이 프로그램은 DOS 모드에서 실행할 수 없습니다.
tests.output: This program cannot be run in DOS mode.
tests.llm_output: This program could not be executed in DOS mode.

tests.input: 이 컴퓨터는 펜티엄 마이크로프로세서를 탑재했어.
tests.output: This computer has a Pentium microprocessor.
tests.llm_output: This computer is equipped with a pentium microprocessor.

tests.input: 우리 할아버지는 제2차 세계 대전 때 돌아가셨다.
tests.output: My grandfather was killed in World War II.
tests.llm_output: My grandfather died in World War Il.

tests.input: 비행기는 오후 2시 30분에 보스턴을 떠났다.
tests.output: The plane took off from Boston at 2:30.
tests.llm_output: The plane left Boston at 2:30 p.m.

tests.input: 톰은 보스턴이 여행하기 좋은 곳이라고 말했다.
tests.output: Tom said Boston is a nice place to visit.
tests.llm_output: Tom said Boston was a good place to travel.

tests.input: 우리는 인접 국가들과의 교역을 촉진하여야 합니다.
tests.output: We must promote commerce with neighboring countries.
tests.llm_output: We need to promote trade with neighboring countries.

tests.input: 나는 가족을 먹여 살리기 위해 열심히 일했다.
tests.output: I worked hard in order to support my family.
tests.llm_output: I worked hard to feed my family.

tests.input: '고기능 자폐증'은 의학용어나 진단명이 아니야.
tests.output: High-functioning autism isn't an official medical term or diagnosis.
tests.llm_output: High-functional autism is not a medical term or a diagnosis.

tests.input: 해가 뜨기까지는 그리 오래 걸리지 않을 것이다.
tests.output: It won't be long before the sun rises.
tests.llm_output: It won't take long for the sun to rise.

tests.input: 그 소녀들은 내일 테니스를 치고 싶어하지 않는다.
tests.output: The girls won't play tennis tomorrow.
tests.llm_output: They don't want to play tennis tomorrow.

tests.input: 만약 네티즌들이 벌이라면 벌통은 누구의 것인가?
tests.output: If Internet users are bees, who owns the beehives?
tests.llm_output: If the Netizens are bees, who is the hive?

tests.input: 저는 다른 사람들의 다양한 생각을 듣고싶어요.
tests.output: I'd like to hear other people's different thoughts.
tests.llm_output: I want to hear a lot of other people's ideas.

tests.input: 그의 회사가 생산하는 기계가 우리것보다 뛰어나다.
tests.output: Machines that his company produces are superior to ours.
tests.llm_output: His company produces better machines than ours.

tests.input: 그의 아내는 처음으로 코로나19 증상을 보이기 시작했다.
tests.output: His wife first started showing symptoms of COVID-19.
tests.llm_output: His wife began to show symptoms of corona19 for the first time.

tests.input: 오늘은 너무 힘들어서 오늘 밤 푹 잘 것 같다.
tests.output: Today was so hard I think I'll sleep well tonight.
tests.llm_output: I'm going to sleep tonight because it's so hard.

tests.input: 해가 뜨기까지는 그리 오래 걸리지 않을 것이다.
tests.output: It will not be long before the sun rises.
tests.llm_output: It won't take long for the sun to rise.

tests.input: 계획을 세우는 것과 그것을 실행하는 것은 별개의 문제다.
tests.output: Making a plan and actually following through are two separate problems.
tests.llm_output: It's a separate matter to plan and to do it.

tests.input: 이미 이사했습니다. 이제 자신은 혼자 살고 있습니다.
tests.output: I've moved out already. Now I live alone.
tests.llm_output: He's already moved in. Now he's living alone.

tests.input: 그는 수년간 택시 운전사로 일해 왔기에 이 도시를 잘 안다.
tests.output: Having worked for several years as a taxi driver, he knows the city well.
tests.llm_output: He's been a cab driver for years, so I know this city.

tests.input: 부자인데 착한 게 아니라, 부자라서 착한 것이다.
tests.output: I'm not nice even though I'm rich; I'm nice because I'm rich.
tests.llm_output: He's rich, and he's not good, but he's rich and he's good.

tests.input: 네가 아인슈타인이 아니라도 그 문제를 풀 수 있다.
tests.output: You don't have to be Einstein to work that out.
tests.llm_output: Even if you're not Einstein, you can solve the problem.

tests.input: 나는 격려의 말을 할 수 있었다. 나는 최근에 기분이 정말 안 좋았다.
tests.output: I could use some words of encouragement. I’ve been feeling really down lately.
tests.llm_output: I was able to say something encouraging. I felt really bad lately.

tests.input: 그래서 나는 프랑스에 오래 머무르고 싶고, 그러기 위한 돈이 필요하다.

tests.llm_output: So I want to stay in France for a long time, and I need money to do that.
